results.title: Mountain family in Europe
results.brief_description: Passing through a mountain valley to a small village, the camera follows a tractor up the hillsides to the summer grazing area. Here the summer activities are seen: the milking of cows by hand, the making of cheese and the cutting, drying and collection of hay. No commentary. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Mountain building
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Earth revealed”.
Mountains are evidence which enable geologists to study not only the movements of the Earth’s plates, but the composition of the interior structure of the Mantle. The Rock cycle whereby material from and below the crust is metamorphosed is also explained which enables geologists to determined how land masses are created and fused together into larger parts, eventually becoming mountain ranges. Fossil evidence and magnetic forces enable the geologist to determine the age and structure of terrain.

results.title: Mount Lofty Ranges: a total picture
results.brief_description: Investigates how life in this delicate ecological system affects all South Australians and the conservation and development options now necessary to protect our environmentally threatened Ranges. It asks the question “Can we cater for the changing land - use demands and still maintain a balanced environment?”
results.description: Investigates how life in this delicate ecological system affects all South Australians and the conservation and development options now necessary to protect our environmentally threatened Ranges. results.title: Mount Isa copper
results.creator_credit: Eric Thompson, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Antonio Colacino
results.brief_description: Tells the story of the copper industry based at Mt Isa in Queensland. Introduces typical workers and a housewife living in the town of 14,000 people. Shows completion of refining at Stuart near Townsville of pure copper suited to electrical use. Commentary by Shan Benson.

results.title: Mount Gambier
results.brief_description: A typical Australian family living in Mount Gambier, south Australia. Shows rural agricultural and manufacturing industry of the area and features the recreational pastimes of members of the family.

results.title: Mount Buffalo National Park
results.brief_description: A summer-time study of one of Victoria’s most popular holiday resorts. Mount Buffalo provides facilities for snow sports in winter, and is ideal for hiking, fishing, climbing and cross-country walking in summer. Commentary by Terry Dear, photography by Roy Driver.

results.title: Moulding with a three-part flask
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Foundry Practice”.
Use of a deep follow board, techniques of facing, ramming and venting a deep green sand core; how to use a check in a three-part flask; and the purpose and method of step-gating

results.title: Moulding on a jolt roll-over pattern drawn machine
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Foundry Practice”.
Explains the principles of the jolt roll-over pattern draw machine; how to fill the drag and jolt it; how to draw the pattern; set the drag and cop pattern plates; fill the cope and jolt it; and finish and close the mould.

results.title: Mouchette
results.creator_credit: Anatole Dauman, Argos Films, Parc Film and Robert Bresson
results.brief_description: Based on the Georges Bernanos novel “Nouvelle histiore de Mouchette”, Robert Bresson’s unflinching tale of poverty and cruelty is an agonising and unsentimental film experience. Mouchette (Nadine Nortier) is a 14 year old peasant school girl. Her mother is dying and her father is a brutal alcoholic, leaving her to fend for herself and her baby brother amidst a harsh and indifferent community. When local poacher Arsene (Jean-Claude Guilbert) turns to Mouchette for an alibi over a possible murder, the young girl desperately responds to his neediness, unaware that she is being used yet again. Bresson strips scenes, performances and emotions down to their bare necessities, creating a unique style which at first might seem alienating but ultimately depicts the human experience with mystery, grace and poignancy. In French with English subtitles. Cast also includes Maria Cardinal, Paul Herbert, Jean Vimenet (Awards: Best film 1967 Venice Film festival)

results.title: Motown 25: Yesterday, Today, Forever
results.brief_description: Hosted by Richard Pryor, this is a fast paced, all star reunion that spotlights performances by the biggest acts ever to come out of Detroit including vintage footage of the groups from the sixties and seventies. It looks behind the scenes into what made Motown tick, the songwriters who helped bring the Motown sound to fame and the man who started it all, the legendary Berry Gordy. Rated: G
